_header: Christ that art light clearness and day
_description: James Ryman, another version of ‘Criste qui lux’ — seven quatrains (aabb) plus burden (cccd): ‘Criste qui lux es et dies / Noctis tenebras detegis / Lucisque lumen crederis / Lumen beatum predicans

CULEe112.First Lines:
Crist that art light clerenes and dayDerknes of nyght doist a
                    way…
CULEe112.Last Lines:
…With the ffader an hy and holigostEternally in euery
                    cost
CULEe112.Note: Possibly a continuation of 1008 on f. 3.
CULEe112.Editions:
Zupitza,  Julius,
                        ed.  
             “Die Gedichte des Franziskaners Jacob Ryman.” 
             Archiv für das Studium der neueren Sprachen und
                Literaturen
         89 (1892): 167-338: 325-6.
